Interpreter

This module provides an interpreter for parsed Words tokens.

class words.interpreter.interpret.Interpreter

The Interpreter class is used to for interpreting a Words program.

static interpret(program: Program, init: List) → Optional[any]

Interpret a program.

Parameters

  • program – The program to interpret.

  • init – The initial values to place on the stack.

Returns

The return value of the program executed, if any.

static interpret_file(file_path: Path, init: list) → Optional[any]

Interpret from a file, this is the most common entrypoint for the interpreter.

Parameters

  • file_path – Path to the file to interpret.

  • init – The initial values to place on the stack.

Returns

The return value of the program executed, if any.

Interpreter Utils

words.interpreter.interpret_util.execute_program(program: Program, init: List) → Optional[any]

Execute a program.

Parameters

  • program – The program to execute. This function is used internally by the interpreter, but can be called directly.

  • init – initial stack provided as an argument to main.

Returns

The return value of the program executed, if any.

words.interpreter.interpret_util.exhaustive_interpret_tokens(tokens_: List[ParserToken], stack_: list, dictionary_: dict) → Tuple[list, dict]

Interpret tokens from list until it is empty.

Parameters

  • tokens – The tokens to interpret.

  • stack – The stack to use for interpreting.

  • dictionary – The dictionary to use for interpreting.

Returns

The resulting stack and dictionary after interpreting.
